alert.note: Alert for Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 24 at 3:58AM PST until February 26 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 18 inches possible for southern and western portions of Mineral County in addition to southern Lyon County. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches possible elsewhere. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties. * WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty southeast winds will cause considerable blowing and drifting of snow and near whiteout conditions. Travel along US-95 and Highway 6 could be greatly impacted, especially for areas from Hawthorne south.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
